etymology.description: ideogram: graphic sign 𠃊 symbolizing something that hides something or someone.
etymology.interpretation: Shape abstracts a covering or tucked stroke suggesting something being hidden from view. As a radical, it imparts the idea of concealment or enclosure to the characters it helps form.

examples.chinese: 匸用于表示隐藏的概念(匸用於表示隱藏的概念)。
examples.pinyin: Xì yòng yú biǎoshì yǐncáng de gàiniàn.
examples.english: Xì is used to denote the concept of concealment.

examples.chinese: 这个部首叫匸部(這個部首叫匸部)。
examples.english: This radical is called the xì radical.

examples.chinese: 匸不是常见的独立汉字(匸不是常見的獨立漢字)。
examples.pinyin: Xì bùshì chángjiàn de dúlì Hànzì.
examples.english: Xì is not a commonly used standalone character.
